name: Electricity, bauxite mining regions
description:
In order to calculate the fuels used to generate electricity for bauxite production, it is necessary to determine the percent of bauxite produced in each of the aforementioned countries. This quantity is calculated from the amount exported to the U.S. as bauxite ore and the amount used within each country to produce alumina, which is then exported to the U.S.
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.
category: 22: Utilities/2211: Electric Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Australia (2%), Jamaica (55 %), Guinea (30%), Brazil (3%), Suriname (1%), and Guyana (9%).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Coal (2%), Nuclear (0.1%), Hydropower (22%), Fuel oil (75%), Natural gas (0.8%)

sources.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG (2007) LCI Primary Aluminum
